The Join Features tool adds attributes from one layer or table to another based on specified spatial and attribute relationships. Optionally, statistics can be calculated when there are multiple matching records.

The layer or table that will have attributes from the join layer appended to its attribute table.

The count of features depends on additional factors such as filtering criteria and the analysis extent.

Layer is specified by default when Target layer is not populated. To add an input table, select Table before adding a dataset.

The layer or table with the attributes that will be appended to the target layer.

The count of features depends on additional factors such as filtering criteria and the analysis extent.

Layer is specified by default when Join layer is not populated. To add an input table, select Table before adding a dataset.

Specifies whether layers will be joined based on a spatial relationship. This requires that both layers have a geometry.

Specifies the spatial relationship that determines which features will be joined. Features in the join layer that have the specified relationship to the target layer will be joined. The available relationships depend on the geometry type of the inputs.

The distance from the features in the target layer that will be used to determine whether features will be joined.

The units that will be used to specify the distance.

Specifies whether layers will be joined based on matching field values. If one or more of the inputs is a table, a join can only be defined using an attribute relationship.

The attribute relationship that determines which features will be joined. Features are matched when the field values in the join layer are equal to field values in the target layer.

Specifies how joins will be handled if multiple records from the join layer meet the join criteria. Choose from the following options:

  • Join one to one—A single record in the join layer will be joined to each feature in the target layer.
  • Join one to many—All the matching features in the join layer will be joined to the target layer. The result layer will contain multiple records of the target feature.

When multiple features in the join layer match a target feature, this parameter specifies whether a single record from the join layer will be joined, summary statistics will be calculated for a chosen field for all matching records from the join layer, or only the count of matching records will be calculated.

When there are multiple join features that match a target feature, summary statistics for all matching records will be calculated. Specify the number or date fields from the join layer and the statistics that will be calculated for each field.

When there are multiple join features that match a target feature, the first record from the join layer's attribute table will be included in the output. Optionally, choose a number or date field and the sort order that will determine the ordering of the attribute table.

Specifies whether unmatched target features will be included in the output. The Inner join option returns only matched target records, whereas the Left join option returns all target records, even if the target feature does not have a match in the join layer.

The name of the layer or table that will be created and added to the map.

The name of the folder in My content where the result will be saved.
